text:
The AMD Ryzen 3 series, known for its impressive performance and cost-effectiveness, stands out as a beacon for budget-conscious consumers and tech enthusiasts alike. This article dives into the world of the best AMD Ryzen 3 laptops, showcasing models that excel not just in raw processing power, but in overall user experience. We'll explore laptops that bring to the table exceptional multitasking abilities, capable graphics, and energy efficiency, all wrapped in sleek designs. 

Whether you're a student, a professional, or a casual user, this comprehensive guide aims to help you make an informed decision in your pursuit of a laptop that doesn't just meet your needs but exceeds your expectations. Prepare to be introduced to a lineup that redefines the standards of budget computing, where each Ryzen 3 laptop we've selected stands as a testament to how far technology has come in making powerful computing accessible to all. The HP Ryzen 3 laptop, featuring the AMD Ryzen 3-3250U processor, is a versatile choice for users seeking a blend of performance and efficiency. It’s equipped with 8GB of RAM, suitable for standard applications like web browsing and office tasks, with an option to upgrade to 16GB for more demanding work. The inclusion of a 512GB solid-state drive ensures fast performance and responsiveness. Its 15.6″ Full HD IPS display delivers quality visuals, enhancing both work and entertainment experiences. The laptop’s design prioritises user comfort, with a well-spaced keyboard and portability. Preinstalled with Windows 10, upgradable to Windows 11, it offers a balance of price and performance, ideal for everyday use without overheating concerns. The Acer One 14 Z2-493, powered by the AMD Ryzen 3 3250U processor, is an affordable yet powerful laptop suitable for both casual and professional users. With a turbo boost up to 3.50GHz, it ensures efficient performance for productivity, web browsing, and light gaming. The 14-inch HD display offers clear, vibrant visuals, while the 8GB DDR4 RAM and 512GB SSD facilitate smooth multitasking and fast data transfers. Running on Windows 11 Home, it features a modern interface and pre-installed Microsoft Office for productivity. Its connectivity options include HDMI, USB ports, and Gigabit LAN. Lightweight and budget-friendly, it’s an excellent choice for those needing a responsive computing experience. The Lenovo V15, powered by the AMD Ryzen 3 5300U processor, is an efficient and practical laptop for diverse computing needs. With a base speed of 2.6 GHz and maxing out at 3.8 GHz, this quad-core processor facilitates smooth multitasking and data processing. It features 8GB DDR4 RAM, upgradeable to 16GB, ensuring responsive performance for various applications. The laptop boasts a 15.6-inch FHD anti-glare display with a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels, offering crisp visuals enhanced by integrated AMD Radeon graphics, suitable for both work and entertainment. It includes a 256GB NVMe SSD, providing quick boot times and fast data access. Connectivity is comprehensive, featuring USB ports, HDMI, Ethernet, and a 3.5mm audio jack, along with Bluetooth 5.0 and LAN support. It offers a secure operating environment. Other notable features include an HD webcam with a privacy shutter, stereo speakers, a spill-resistant keyboard, and a 12-month warranty. The 38 Wh Lithium-Polymer battery ensures adequate runtime, making the Lenovo V15 a reliable, budget-friendly laptop choice. The Dell Inspiron 15 3525, powered by an AMD Ryzen 3 5425U from the advanced 7000 series, is an impressive AMD Ryzen 3 laptop. Its Zen 4 architecture delivers up to 16 cores and 32 threads, reaching a maximum of 5.7 GHz clock speed, making it suitable for gaming and content creation. The laptop features a 15.6-inch display with resolutions of 1366 x 768 or 1920 x 1080, available in touch and non-touch variants. The display’s high screen-to-body ratio, thin bezels, and matte finish enhance the visual experience. It offers 8GB DDR4 RAM, upgradable to 16GB, and a NVMe SSD, ensuring quick data processing and storage. The integrated Radeon RX Vega 6 GPU provides adequate graphics performance but may not be ideal for heavy graphic tasks. The 41 Wh Li-Ion battery supports fast charging, adding to its practicality. For connectivity, it includes USB 3.2 ports, HDMI, an SD card reader, and Bluetooth v5.2, catering to various connectivity needs. The ASUS Vivobook Go 15 OLED, released in March 2023, is a noteworthy AMD Ryzen 3 laptop. It boasts a 15.6-inch display with an ~80.1% screen-to-body ratio and thin bezels, providing an immersive visual experience. The matte screen minimizes reflections, enhancing usability. It’s powered by the AMD Ryzen 3 7320U from the advanced Ryzen 7000 series. This CPU, featuring Zen 4 architecture, offers up to 16 cores and 32 threads with a maximum clock speed of 5.7 GHz, ensuring efficient performance for various tasks, including gaming and content creation. The device includes 8GB of LPDDR5 RAM, offering high speeds for effective multitasking, though it’s not upgradable. Storage is handled by an upgradable NVMe SSD, offering fast access and expandability. The integrated Radeon 610M GPU is energy efficient but not ideal for graphics-intensive applications. It features a 42 Wh Li-Ion battery with fast charging capability, enhancing convenience despite its average capacity. Connectivity options include USB 3.2 ports, but it lacks the latest HDMI standards. This combination of features makes the ASUS Vivobook Go 15 OLED a compelling choice for everyday computing and moderate performance needs. If you can manage to make do without an OLED screen in your AMD Ryzen 3 laptop then the ASUS Vivobook GO 15 could be your next best option. The laptop comes with an Ryzen 3 7320U quad-core APU, meaning it also has a Radeon 610M Dual-core iGPU. In terms of performance, expect this laptop to easily handle all your basic stuff. Ranging from editing spreadsheets and documents to 4k video streaming. The laptop’s screen might not be OLED but it still features an FHD resolution and 84% screen-to-body ratio. Meaning, sharp image output and a relatively bezel-less viewing experience. And the good thing is that this AMD Ryzen 3-powered laptop nails the basics by including a healthy Input-output port selection, privacy shutter webcam, Wi-Fi 6E, and super fast 8GB LPDDR5 RAM running at 5500MHz. ASUS packs all this in a laptop which weighs just 1.63 kg, thus also making it highly portable. If you want the AMD Ryzen 3 goodness in an even more compact package then the Vivobook GO 14, is another more affordable option to consider. Featuring the same Ryzen 3 7320U but this time in a smaller 14-inch chassis, the Vivobook GO 14 positions itself as an affordable compact Windows laptop. The smaller size also contributes to lower weight and therefore the Vivobook GO 14 only weighs 1.38kg. For reference, the 13-inch MacBook Air weighs a mere 130g more. On top of portability, the Vivobook GO 14 also offers a ton of functionality thanks to a very diverse selection of input-output ports, including but not limited to, an HDMI, USB 2.0, USB 3.0, USB-C and USB-A 3.2, and 3.5mm audio jack. The laptop’s keyboard has a 60% layout with a long 1.4mm key travel for easy typing experience. Moreover, ASUS has included NumberPad 2.0 on the touchpad so you get all the features of a Numpad without sacrificing extra space for it. Lastly, the laptop’s 14-inch display gets FHD resolution and the Ryzen 3 APU is paired with 8GB LPDDR5 RAM and a 512GB SSD for seamless performance in everyday tasks.
